title: # Particular benefits: treatment of benefits that are trivial in amount: action to take

details.body:
# Particular benefits: treatment of benefits that are trivial in amount: action to take

Requests that a trivial benefit should be ignored for practical purposes (see [EIM21860](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM21860)) should be dealt with by the appropriate office or contact responsible for dealing with the employer.

If you decide to agree to the request do not record this in a dispensation (see [EIM30050](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM30050)). Instead send a letter to the employer recording what the circumstances are and what has been agreed. Say that if circumstances or amounts change the agreement may not necessarily be relied on.

Preserve a copy of this letter permanently in the employer's records. See COG908080.
